title: Rick and Morty
description: I created the application because I wanted to learn different ways of fetching data in react. At this moment I can fetch, cache, and update data in my applications without a global state thanks to react-query.

title: Study Buddy
description: It is an electronic diary that teachers can use to organize their students. The user can modify classes, notes, and students with pop-up modals. Every single feature in this app was tested with React Testing Library or Cypress.

title: Fylo Landing Page
description: This project is a challenge from Frontend Mentor. It's a fully responsive project thanks to the flexbox and grid. Because of SVG icons, I had a lot of work with advanced responsible styles. Built with next and styled-components.

title: Weather API
description: This project was built with quite an advanced meta-weather API. My folder structure was based on atomic design. To handle state I used redux with redux-thunk. At this moment I would use redux-toolkit or react-query but I want to show you that I can also work with older technologies.

title: Edie homepage
description: The project was built a long time ago at the beginning of my front-end passion. When I was making this project I didn't know how to use any kind of compiler so that's why I have few CSS files. All in all, I created this fully responsible project only using flexbox and media queries so that's why I think it's worth showing it.

title: Github Jobs
description: In the beginning, this site was using GitHub API. Unluckily, this API is no longer available so I was forced to use some kind of service worker to mock the data. That's why this project doesn't work in production. To check this project and run all tests you have to copy this repo. For this project, I used typescript, Mock Service Worker, RTK Query, and so on.
